ISSUE.TITLE: Boolean request args fail validation
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: In rest_validate_request_arg() we cannot use the `! is_bool()` conditional to validate if a request argument is either `true` or `false`. The query string in the url (example: https://demo.wp-api.org/wp-json/wp/v2/categories?hide_empty=true) will be parsed as a string. Which means you will always get the error: { code: "rest_invalid_param", message: "Invalid parameter(s): hide_empty", data: { status: 400, params: { hide_empty: "hide_empty is not of type boolean" } } }

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #2704 from BE-Webdesign/#2616-boolean-validation #2616 boolean validation. This adds the validate and sanitize callbacks for items that are a boolean type. This Pull request handles a bunch of different kinds of boolean values and makes sure they map to their proper value so that you can use the value with confidence within your endpoint callbacks.
